text: John Brophy (January 20, 1933 - May 23, 2016) was a Canadian ice hockey coach and former hockey player. He was born and raised in Antigonish, Nova Scotia. Brophy spent most of his career in minor professional leagues, including 18 years as a player in the Eastern Hockey League and 13 seasons as a coach in the East Coast Hockey League. From 1986 to 1988, he was head coach of the Toronto Maple Leafs of the National Hockey League. Brophy died in his sleep at his home in Antigonish on the morning of May 23, 2016 from a long-illness, aged 83. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Canadian ice hockey coaches Category:Canadian ice hockey defencemen Category:Ice hockey people from Nova Scotia Category:Toronto Maple Leafs
title: John Brophy
